topic.title: How to Control the Image Size in Complex Static Content

body.p: It is common to have text and images mixed together in a :before or :after pseudo element. For example, for notes you may have both artwork and text:
If you want to change the size of the image, you have two options:

ul.li: Separate the image from the text and apply the width and height CSS properties only on the image, using the width and height properties. You could use multiple :before pseudo-elements for that, considering that the farthest content presented before the actual content of an element is matched by the :before with the highest number in the brackets:
